item.title: [508] adding custom gfx
item.dc:creator: @bloodisle bloodisle
item.description:
@bloodisle wrote:

Purpose: To hardcode/edit GFX on a normal 508 LD client.

Difficulty: 4/10? not that hard

Tested On: Bloobooms client http://www.google.org/showthread.php?t=120252

Im acturly amazed at how fast i got this figured out. In the past 35 minutes ive found the gfx class, done some tests with gfx, traced the “forID” method, refactored/found important variables.


First open up Class68_Sub20_Sub13.java and search for:

public static Class70 method1160

you will see somthing like this

public static Class70 method1160(int i, int i_7_) {
	anInt4357++;
	Class70 class70
	    = ((Class70)
	       Class68_Sub13_Sub27.aClass98_3893.method1570(14366, (long) i));
	if (class70 != null)
	    return class70;
	byte[] is = (Class68_Sub13_Sub30.aClass21_3947.method338
		     (Class1_Sub6.method146(i_7_ ^ 0x6f, i), 0,
		      Class68_Sub13_Sub19.method793(i_7_ ^ ~0x57, i)));
	class70 = new Class70();
	if (i_7_ != 1)
	    anInt4363 = -10;
	class70.anInt1277 = i;
	if (is != null)
	    class70.method1336(new Stream(is), -1);
	Class68_Sub13_Sub27.aClass98_3893.method1568(class70, 111, (long) i);
	return class70;
    }

This is the forID method for GFX, also Class70 is SpotAnim from 317

replace this method with:

public static Class70 method1160(int i, int i_7_) {//forID
	anInt4357++;
	Class70 spotAnim
	    = ((Class70)
	       Class68_Sub13_Sub27.aClass98_3893.method1570(14366, (long) i));
	if (spotAnim != null)
	    return spotAnim;
	byte[] is = (Class68_Sub13_Sub30.aClass21_3947.method338
		     (Class1_Sub6.method146(i_7_ ^ 0x6f, i), 0,
		      Class68_Sub13_Sub19.method793(i_7_ ^ ~0x57, i)));
	spotAnim = new Class70();
	if (i_7_ != 1)
	    anInt4363 = -10;
	spotAnim.anInt1277 = i;
	if (is != null)
	    spotAnim.method1336(new Stream(is), -1);
	Class68_Sub13_Sub27.aClass98_3893.method1568(spotAnim, 111, (long) i);
	switch(i)
     	{

		case 625://your custom gfx
     		spotAnim.anInt1282 = 419;//originalDataID (Animation)
		spotAnim.anInt1267 = 14997;//gfx model id
     		break;

     		case 726://edited vengeance
     		spotAnim.anInt1264 = 300;//scaleModelWidth
     		spotAnim.anInt1266 = 300;//scaleModelHeight
     		break;
     
     	}
	return spotAnim;
    }

It works pretty much the same as 317, ill keep updating this post when i find more variables.

list of variables - more to come

anInt1264 - scaleModelWidth
anInt1266 - scaleModelHeight
anInt1267 - GFX model id
anInt1282 - originalDataID (animation thats the gfx does)

note
as you can see the forID is not in the SpotAnim class (Class70), what you can do is download a program like eclipse and use the refactor tools to easily move the method to Class70, then you can add your gfx in the correct class, more organised.

Read full topic
